newsitem.title: CANADA: Canada outraged at Jerusalem bombing, urges talks.
newsitem.headline: Canada outraged at Jerusalem bombing, urges talks.

text.p: Canadian Prime Minister Jean Chretien voiced outrage and sorrow at Wednesday's bombings in a Jerusalem market but urged all parties to resume talks.

"These senseless acts of terrorism inflict untold pain and suffering on innocent people. Such barbaric acts must not be allow to destroy the hopes of the people in the region for a just and lasting peace," Chretien said in a statement.
"I urge all the parties to resume direct negotiations."
Fourteen people were killed and more than 150 injured in the lunchtime attack by two Arab suicide bombers, Israeli police said.
